news.title: Woman ‘beaten to a pulp’ and burnt with blow torch during three-hours of torture says she will never forgive ‘animals’ who attacked her
news.summary: A woman who was repeatedly beaten with weapons, burnt with a blow torch, and told she would be raped during a three-hour torture ordeal has said she will “never forgive the animals” who attacked her.

news.title: Enoch Burke wins Court of Appeal challenge over make-up of dismissal appeals panel
news.summary: Controversial schoolteacher Enoch Burke has won a legal challenge against the composition of a disciplinary appeals panel set up to consider his dismissal from Wilson’s Hospital School.

news.title: HSE paid supplier €723k twice and has not clawed back overpayment
news.summary: The HSE paid a supplier €723,000 twice and has not recovered the overpayment according to the State auditor.

news.title: Weight tax for SUVs now on the table for Budget 2026 as strategy papers offer a glimpse at potential measures
news.summary: A tax on family SUVs is being considered among a number of options ahead of Budget 2026.

news.title: Philly McMahon: I think Donegal will win but if you hang around long enough, I’ll build you a sturdy argument for Kerry
news.summary: Punditry is a mug’s game. Evidence of which was in hearty supply last week. Everyone went for Cork in the hurling final. Everyone.

news.title: Almost 16,000 people homeless as another record high reached
news.summary: Homelessness has reached another record high in Ireland as the number of people using emergency accommodation rose to 15,915.

news.title: 30 things wedding guests secretly hate – ‘When people put in the invitation they want cash as a gift, it just doesn’t bode well'
news.summary: There are many common guest complaints about weddings, whether it’s ceremonies that are too long, too far away or too expensive. But there’s also a whole other list of lesser-known bugbears that can quickly turn a joyous celebration into a sour one for those in attendance.

news.title: Michael Flatley to make bid for Irish presidency, court told
news.summary: Riverdance star Michael Flatley is to seek a nomination to become Ireland’s next president, a court has heard.

news.title: Modern Morals: I shared my business idea with a friend but she stole it – now it’s a big success
Bill Linnane: I want to turn my 22-year-old daughter’s bedroom into a home office – but she still thinks it’s her room
news.summary: There have been many of us impacted by the housing crisis in Ireland, but it is important to remember the real victims – people who want their adult children to move out so they can turn their bedrooms into a home office.
